intro: Coleanthus subtilis, commonly known as the slender bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in alpine environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a delicate and somewhat elusive species in the botanical world.
